      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by tomva...@gmail.com (Feb 8, 2022)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br><br>The value of PerformanceResourceTiming.fetchStart is set to the time _after_ redirects for opaque responses. Comparing this value with the time that a `fetch()` was initiated leaks whether a redirect occurred (similar to #1157818 and #1251179).<span class="line"><!---->The value of PerformanceResourceTiming.fetchStart is set to the time _after_ redirects for opaque responses. Comparing this value with the time that a `fetch()` was initiated leaks whether a redirect occurred (similar to #1157818 and #1251179).<!----></span><br>This behaviour deviates from the Fetch spec (<span class="line"><!---->This behaviour deviates from the Fetch spec (<!----></span>https://fetch.spec.whatwg.org/#create-an-opaque-timing-info<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://fetch.spec.whatwg.org/#create-an-opaque-timing-info"><!---->https://fetch.spec.whatwg.org/#create-an-opaque-timing-info<!----></a>):<span class="line"><!---->):<!----></span><br><br>> To create an opaque timing info, given a fetch timing info timingInfo, return a new fetch timing info whose start time and post-redirect start time are timingInfo’s start time.<span class="line"><!---->&gt; To create an opaque timing info, given a fetch timing info timingInfo, return a new fetch timing info whose start time and post-redirect start time are timingInfo’s start time.<!----></span><br><br>In essence: fetchStart refers to the post-redirect start time, but for opaque responses this value should be set to the fetch start time.<span class="line"><!---->In essence: fetchStart refers to the post-redirect start time, but for opaque responses this value should be set to the fetch start time.<!----></span><br><br>For reference, the Resource Timing spec states (<span class="line"><!---->For reference, the Resource Timing spec states (<!----></span>https://w3c.github.io/resource-timing/#dom-performanceresourcetiming-fetchstart<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://w3c.github.io/resource-timing/#dom-performanceresourcetiming-fetchstart"><!---->https://w3c.github.io/resource-timing/#dom-performanceresourcetiming-fetchstart<!----></a>):<span class="line"><!---->):<!----></span><br><br>> The fetchStart getter steps are to convert fetch timestamp for this's timing info's post-redirect start time and the relevant global object for this. See HTTP fetch for more info.<span class="line"><!---->&gt; The fetchStart getter steps are to convert fetch timestamp for this's timing info's post-redirect start time and the relevant global object for this. See HTTP fetch for more info.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: tested on 100.0.4868.0 (canary) & stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: tested on 100.0.4868.0 (canary) &amp; stable<!----></span><br>Operating System: all<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: all<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>async function isRedirected(url) {  <span class="line"><!---->async function isRedirected(url) {  <!----></span><br>    const href = new URL(url).href;<span class="line"><!---->    const href = new URL(url).href;<!----></span><br>    const start = performance.now();<span class="line"><!---->    const start = performance.now();<!----></span><br>    await fetch(href, {mode: "no-cors", credentials: "include" });<span class="line"><!---->    await fetch(href, {mode: "no-cors", credentials: "include" });<!----></span><br>    // Wait for request to be added to performance.getEntriesByName();<span class="line"><!---->    // Wait for request to be added to performance.getEntriesByName();<!----></span><br>    await new Promise(r => setTimeout(r, 200));<span class="line"><!---->    await new Promise(r =&gt; setTimeout(r, 200));<!----></span><br>    // Get last added timings<span class="line"><!---->    // Get last added timings<!----></span><br>    let res = performance.getEntriesByName(href).pop();<span class="line"><!---->    let res = performance.getEntriesByName(href).pop();<!----></span><br>    const diff = res.fetchStart - start;<span class="line"><!---->    const diff = res.fetchStart - start;<!----></span><br>    console.log('diff', diff);<span class="line"><!---->    console.log('diff', diff);<!----></span><br>    if(diff >= 1) return true<span class="line"><!---->    if(diff &gt;= 1) return true<!----></span><br>    return false;<span class="line"><!---->    return false;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>await isRedirected('<span class="line"><!---->await isRedirected('<!----></span>https://google.com');<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://google.com');"><!---->https://google.com');<!----></a> // diff: 169.5<span class="line"><!----> // diff: 169.5<!----></span><br>-><span class="line"><!---->-&gt;<!----></span><br>true<span class="line"><!---->true<!----></span><br><br>await isRedirected('<span class="line"><!---->await isRedirected('<!----></span>https://www.google.com');<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.google.com');"><!---->https://www.google.com');<!----></a> // diff: 0.20<span class="line"><!----> // diff: 0.20<!----></span><br>-><span class="line"><!---->-&gt;<!----></span><br>false<span class="line"><!---->false<!----></span><br><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br><br>Reporter credit: Tom Van Goethem<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Tom Van Goethem<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">
      
        <slot></slot>

        <slot></slot>
      </label>

    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);

    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);

    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;

    line-height: 1.6;

    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;

    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

                  <!---->:

                <span class="key-tip"><!---->show this help dialog<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
        </div>
        
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        <p>
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        </p>
      <chops-dialog>
        <h2>
          Issue tracker keyboard shortcuts
          <button class="close-button">
            Close
          </button>
        </h2>
        <div class="keyboard-help">
          <!---->
            <div class="keyboard-help-section">
              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Issue list<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->up/down in the list<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->o<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->open the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Shift-O<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->open issue in new tab<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->x<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->select the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
            <div class="keyboard-help-section">
              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Issue details<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->prev/next issue in list<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->u<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->up to issue list<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->r<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>

          Note:<b>Note:</b>
          Clock icons indicate that users may not be available.
          Tooltips show the reason.

          <b>Note:</b>
          Clock icons indicate that users may not be available.
          Tooltips show the reason.

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br><br>The value of PerformanceResourceTiming.fetchStart is set to the time _after_ redirects for opaque responses. Comparing this value with the time that a `fetch()` was initiated leaks whether a redirect occurred (similar to #1157818 and #1251179).<span class="line"><!---->The value of PerformanceResourceTiming.fetchStart is set to the time _after_ redirects for opaque responses. Comparing this value with the time that a `fetch()` was initiated leaks whether a redirect occurred (similar to #1157818 and #1251179).<!----></span><br>This behaviour deviates from the Fetch spec (<span class="line"><!---->This behaviour deviates from the Fetch spec (<!----></span>https://fetch.spec.whatwg.org/#create-an-opaque-timing-info<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://fetch.spec.whatwg.org/#create-an-opaque-timing-info"><!---->https://fetch.spec.whatwg.org/#create-an-opaque-timing-info<!----></a>):<span class="line"><!---->):<!----></span><br><br>> To create an opaque timing info, given a fetch timing info timingInfo, return a new fetch timing info whose start time and post-redirect start time are timingInfo’s start time.<span class="line"><!---->&gt; To create an opaque timing info, given a fetch timing info timingInfo, return a new fetch timing info whose start time and post-redirect start time are timingInfo’s start time.<!----></span><br><br>In essence: fetchStart refers to the post-redirect start time, but for opaque responses this value should be set to the fetch start time.<span class="line"><!---->In essence: fetchStart refers to the post-redirect start time, but for opaque responses this value should be set to the fetch start time.<!----></span><br><br>For reference, the Resource Timing spec states (<span class="line"><!---->For reference, the Resource Timing spec states (<!----></span>https://w3c.github.io/resource-timing/#dom-performanceresourcetiming-fetchstart<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://w3c.github.io/resource-timing/#dom-performanceresourcetiming-fetchstart"><!---->https://w3c.github.io/resource-timing/#dom-performanceresourcetiming-fetchstart<!----></a>):<span class="line"><!---->):<!----></span><br><br>> The fetchStart getter steps are to convert fetch timestamp for this's timing info's post-redirect start time and the relevant global object for this. See HTTP fetch for more info.<span class="line"><!---->&gt; The fetchStart getter steps are to convert fetch timestamp for this's timing info's post-redirect start time and the relevant global object for this. See HTTP fetch for more info.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: tested on 100.0.4868.0 (canary) & stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: tested on 100.0.4868.0 (canary) &amp; stable<!----></span><br>Operating System: all<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: all<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>async function isRedirected(url) {  <span class="line"><!---->async function isRedirected(url) {  <!----></span><br>    const href = new URL(url).href;<span class="line"><!---->    const href = new URL(url).href;<!----></span><br>    const start = performance.now();<span class="line"><!---->    const start = performance.now();<!----></span><br>    await fetch(href, {mode: "no-cors", credentials: "include" });<span class="line"><!---->    await fetch(href, {mode: "no-cors", credentials: "include" });<!----></span><br>    // Wait for request to be added to performance.getEntriesByName();<span class="line"><!---->    // Wait for request to be added to performance.getEntriesByName();<!----></span><br>    await new Promise(r => setTimeout(r, 200));<span class="line"><!---->    await new Promise(r =&gt; setTimeout(r, 200));<!----></span><br>    // Get last added timings<span class="line"><!---->    // Get last added timings<!----></span><br>    let res = performance.getEntriesByName(href).pop();<span class="line"><!---->    let res = performance.getEntriesByName(href).pop();<!----></span><br>    const diff = res.fetchStart - start;<span class="line"><!---->    const diff = res.fetchStart - start;<!----></span><br>    console.log('diff', diff);<span class="line"><!---->    console.log('diff', diff);<!----></span><br>    if(diff >= 1) return true<span class="line"><!---->    if(diff &gt;= 1) return true<!----></span><br>    return false;<span class="line"><!---->    return false;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>await isRedirected('<span class="line"><!---->await isRedirected('<!----></span>https://google.com');<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://google.com');"><!---->https://google.com');<!----></a> // diff: 169.5<span class="line"><!----> // diff: 169.5<!----></span><br>-><span class="line"><!---->-&gt;<!----></span><br>true<span class="line"><!---->true<!----></span><br><br>await isRedirected('<span class="line"><!---->await isRedirected('<!----></span>https://www.google.com');<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.google.com');"><!---->https://www.google.com');<!----></a> // diff: 0.20<span class="line"><!----> // diff: 0.20<!----></span><br>-><span class="line"><!---->-&gt;<!----></span><br>false<span class="line"><!---->false<!----></span><br><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br><br>Reporter credit: Tom Van Goethem<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Tom Van Goethem<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
      
        
      <div>
        
      </div>

      <style>
        mr-issue-details {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background-color: var(--chops-white);
          padding-bottom: 1em;
          display: flex;

        }

          margin-top: 1em;
        }

          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        mr-edit-issue {
          margin-top: 40px;
        }
      </style>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>

          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;

          z-index: 100;

          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;

        mr-issue-details {

          max-width: 1000px;

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        Description #1 by tomva...@gmail.com (Feb 8, 2022)

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br><br>The value of PerformanceResourceTiming.fetchStart is set to the time _after_ redirects for opaque responses. Comparing this value with the time that a `fetch()` was initiated leaks whether a redirect occurred (similar to #1157818 and #1251179).<span class="line"><!---->The value of PerformanceResourceTiming.fetchStart is set to the time _after_ redirects for opaque responses. Comparing this value with the time that a `fetch()` was initiated leaks whether a redirect occurred (similar to #1157818 and #1251179).<!----></span><br>This behaviour deviates from the Fetch spec (<span class="line"><!---->This behaviour deviates from the Fetch spec (<!----></span>https://fetch.spec.whatwg.org/#create-an-opaque-timing-info<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://fetch.spec.whatwg.org/#create-an-opaque-timing-info"><!---->https://fetch.spec.whatwg.org/#create-an-opaque-timing-info<!----></a>):<span class="line"><!---->):<!----></span><br><br>> To create an opaque timing info, given a fetch timing info timingInfo, return a new fetch timing info whose start time and post-redirect start time are timingInfo’s start time.<span class="line"><!---->&gt; To create an opaque timing info, given a fetch timing info timingInfo, return a new fetch timing info whose start time and post-redirect start time are timingInfo’s start time.<!----></span><br><br>In essence: fetchStart refers to the post-redirect start time, but for opaque responses this value should be set to the fetch start time.<span class="line"><!---->In essence: fetchStart refers to the post-redirect start time, but for opaque responses this value should be set to the fetch start time.<!----></span><br><br>For reference, the Resource Timing spec states (<span class="line"><!---->For reference, the Resource Timing spec states (<!----></span>https://w3c.github.io/resource-timing/#dom-performanceresourcetiming-fetchstart<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://w3c.github.io/resource-timing/#dom-performanceresourcetiming-fetchstart"><!---->https://w3c.github.io/resource-timing/#dom-performanceresourcetiming-fetchstart<!----></a>):<span class="line"><!---->):<!----></span><br><br>> The fetchStart getter steps are to convert fetch timestamp for this's timing info's post-redirect start time and the relevant global object for this. See HTTP fetch for more info.<span class="line"><!---->&gt; The fetchStart getter steps are to convert fetch timestamp for this's timing info's post-redirect start time and the relevant global object for this. See HTTP fetch for more info.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: tested on 100.0.4868.0 (canary) & stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: tested on 100.0.4868.0 (canary) &amp; stable<!----></span><br>Operating System: all<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: all<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>async function isRedirected(url) {  <span class="line"><!---->async function isRedirected(url) {  <!----></span><br>    const href = new URL(url).href;<span class="line"><!---->    const href = new URL(url).href;<!----></span><br>    const start = performance.now();<span class="line"><!---->    const start = performance.now();<!----></span><br>    await fetch(href, {mode: "no-cors", credentials: "include" });<span class="line"><!---->    await fetch(href, {mode: "no-cors", credentials: "include" });<!----></span><br>    // Wait for request to be added to performance.getEntriesByName();<span class="line"><!---->    // Wait for request to be added to performance.getEntriesByName();<!----></span><br>    await new Promise(r => setTimeout(r, 200));<span class="line"><!---->    await new Promise(r =&gt; setTimeout(r, 200));<!----></span><br>    // Get last added timings<span class="line"><!---->    // Get last added timings<!----></span><br>    let res = performance.getEntriesByName(href).pop();<span class="line"><!---->    let res = performance.getEntriesByName(href).pop();<!----></span><br>    const diff = res.fetchStart - start;<span class="line"><!---->    const diff = res.fetchStart - start;<!----></span><br>    console.log('diff', diff);<span class="line"><!---->    console.log('diff', diff);<!----></span><br>    if(diff >= 1) return true<span class="line"><!---->    if(diff &gt;= 1) return true<!----></span><br>    return false;<span class="line"><!---->    return false;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>await isRedirected('<span class="line"><!---->await isRedirected('<!----></span>https://google.com');<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://google.com');"><!---->https://google.com');<!----></a> // diff: 169.5<span class="line"><!----> // diff: 169.5<!----></span><br>-><span class="line"><!---->-&gt;<!----></span><br>true<span class="line"><!---->true<!----></span><br><br>await isRedirected('<span class="line"><!---->await isRedirected('<!----></span>https://www.google.com');<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.google.com');"><!---->https://www.google.com');<!----></a> // diff: 0.20<span class="line"><!----> // diff: 0.20<!----></span><br>-><span class="line"><!---->-&gt;<!----></span><br>false<span class="line"><!---->false<!----></span><br><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br><br>Reporter credit: Tom Van Goethem<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Tom Van Goethem<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">

      </label>

    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;

          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {

          overflow-y: auto;

          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        Description #1 by tomva...@gmail.com (Feb 8, 2022)

        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br><br>The value of PerformanceResourceTiming.fetchStart is set to the time _after_ redirects for opaque responses. Comparing this value with the time that a `fetch()` was initiated leaks whether a redirect occurred (similar to #1157818 and #1251179).<span class="line"><!---->The value of PerformanceResourceTiming.fetchStart is set to the time _after_ redirects for opaque responses. Comparing this value with the time that a `fetch()` was initiated leaks whether a redirect occurred (similar to #1157818 and #1251179).<!----></span><br>This behaviour deviates from the Fetch spec (<span class="line"><!---->This behaviour deviates from the Fetch spec (<!----></span>https://fetch.spec.whatwg.org/#create-an-opaque-timing-info<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://fetch.spec.whatwg.org/#create-an-opaque-timing-info"><!---->https://fetch.spec.whatwg.org/#create-an-opaque-timing-info<!----></a>):<span class="line"><!---->):<!----></span><br><br>> To create an opaque timing info, given a fetch timing info timingInfo, return a new fetch timing info whose start time and post-redirect start time are timingInfo’s start time.<span class="line"><!---->&gt; To create an opaque timing info, given a fetch timing info timingInfo, return a new fetch timing info whose start time and post-redirect start time are timingInfo’s start time.<!----></span><br><br>In essence: fetchStart refers to the post-redirect start time, but for opaque responses this value should be set to the fetch start time.<span class="line"><!---->In essence: fetchStart refers to the post-redirect start time, but for opaque responses this value should be set to the fetch start time.<!----></span><br><br>For reference, the Resource Timing spec states (<span class="line"><!---->For reference, the Resource Timing spec states (<!----></span>https://w3c.github.io/resource-timing/#dom-performanceresourcetiming-fetchstart<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://w3c.github.io/resource-timing/#dom-performanceresourcetiming-fetchstart"><!---->https://w3c.github.io/resource-timing/#dom-performanceresourcetiming-fetchstart<!----></a>):<span class="line"><!---->):<!----></span><br><br>> The fetchStart getter steps are to convert fetch timestamp for this's timing info's post-redirect start time and the relevant global object for this. See HTTP fetch for more info.<span class="line"><!---->&gt; The fetchStart getter steps are to convert fetch timestamp for this's timing info's post-redirect start time and the relevant global object for this. See HTTP fetch for more info.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: tested on 100.0.4868.0 (canary) & stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: tested on 100.0.4868.0 (canary) &amp; stable<!----></span><br>Operating System: all<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: all<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>async function isRedirected(url) {  <span class="line"><!---->async function isRedirected(url) {  <!----></span><br>    const href = new URL(url).href;<span class="line"><!---->    const href = new URL(url).href;<!----></span><br>    const start = performance.now();<span class="line"><!---->    const start = performance.now();<!----></span><br>    await fetch(href, {mode: "no-cors", credentials: "include" });<span class="line"><!---->    await fetch(href, {mode: "no-cors", credentials: "include" });<!----></span><br>    // Wait for request to be added to performance.getEntriesByName();<span class="line"><!---->    // Wait for request to be added to performance.getEntriesByName();<!----></span><br>    await new Promise(r => setTimeout(r, 200));<span class="line"><!---->    await new Promise(r =&gt; setTimeout(r, 200));<!----></span><br>    // Get last added timings<span class="line"><!---->    // Get last added timings<!----></span><br>    let res = performance.getEntriesByName(href).pop();<span class="line"><!---->    let res = performance.getEntriesByName(href).pop();<!----></span><br>    const diff = res.fetchStart - start;<span class="line"><!---->    const diff = res.fetchStart - start;<!----></span><br>    console.log('diff', diff);<span class="line"><!---->    console.log('diff', diff);<!----></span><br>    if(diff >= 1) return true<span class="line"><!---->    if(diff &gt;= 1) return true<!----></span><br>    return false;<span class="line"><!---->    return false;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>await isRedirected('<span class="line"><!---->await isRedirected('<!----></span>https://google.com');<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://google.com');"><!---->https://google.com');<!----></a> // diff: 169.5<span class="line"><!----> // diff: 169.5<!----></span><br>-><span class="line"><!---->-&gt;<!----></span><br>true<span class="line"><!---->true<!----></span><br><br>await isRedirected('<span class="line"><!---->await isRedirected('<!----></span>https://www.google.com');<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.google.com');"><!---->https://www.google.com');<!----></a> // diff: 0.20<span class="line"><!----> // diff: 0.20<!----></span><br>-><span class="line"><!---->-&gt;<!----></span><br>false<span class="line"><!---->false<!----></span><br><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br><br>Reporter credit: Tom Van Goethem<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Tom Van Goethem<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
      
        
      <div>
        
      </div>
    <mr-description></mr-description>

        Description #1 by tomva...@gmail.com (Feb 8, 2022)

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br><br>The value of PerformanceResourceTiming.fetchStart is set to the time _after_ redirects for opaque responses. Comparing this value with the time that a `fetch()` was initiated leaks whether a redirect occurred (similar to #1157818 and #1251179).<span class="line"><!---->The value of PerformanceResourceTiming.fetchStart is set to the time _after_ redirects for opaque responses. Comparing this value with the time that a `fetch()` was initiated leaks whether a redirect occurred (similar to #1157818 and #1251179).<!----></span><br>This behaviour deviates from the Fetch spec (<span class="line"><!---->This behaviour deviates from the Fetch spec (<!----></span>https://fetch.spec.whatwg.org/#create-an-opaque-timing-info<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://fetch.spec.whatwg.org/#create-an-opaque-timing-info"><!---->https://fetch.spec.whatwg.org/#create-an-opaque-timing-info<!----></a>):<span class="line"><!---->):<!----></span><br><br>> To create an opaque timing info, given a fetch timing info timingInfo, return a new fetch timing info whose start time and post-redirect start time are timingInfo’s start time.<span class="line"><!---->&gt; To create an opaque timing info, given a fetch timing info timingInfo, return a new fetch timing info whose start time and post-redirect start time are timingInfo’s start time.<!----></span><br><br>In essence: fetchStart refers to the post-redirect start time, but for opaque responses this value should be set to the fetch start time.<span class="line"><!---->In essence: fetchStart refers to the post-redirect start time, but for opaque responses this value should be set to the fetch start time.<!----></span><br><br>For reference, the Resource Timing spec states (<span class="line"><!---->For reference, the Resource Timing spec states (<!----></span>https://w3c.github.io/resource-timing/#dom-performanceresourcetiming-fetchstart<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://w3c.github.io/resource-timing/#dom-performanceresourcetiming-fetchstart"><!---->https://w3c.github.io/resource-timing/#dom-performanceresourcetiming-fetchstart<!----></a>):<span class="line"><!---->):<!----></span><br><br>> The fetchStart getter steps are to convert fetch timestamp for this's timing info's post-redirect start time and the relevant global object for this. See HTTP fetch for more info.<span class="line"><!---->&gt; The fetchStart getter steps are to convert fetch timestamp for this's timing info's post-redirect start time and the relevant global object for this. See HTTP fetch for more info.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: tested on 100.0.4868.0 (canary) & stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: tested on 100.0.4868.0 (canary) &amp; stable<!----></span><br>Operating System: all<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: all<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>async function isRedirected(url) {  <span class="line"><!---->async function isRedirected(url) {  <!----></span><br>    const href = new URL(url).href;<span class="line"><!---->    const href = new URL(url).href;<!----></span><br>    const start = performance.now();<span class="line"><!---->    const start = performance.now();<!----></span><br>    await fetch(href, {mode: "no-cors", credentials: "include" });<span class="line"><!---->    await fetch(href, {mode: "no-cors", credentials: "include" });<!----></span><br>    // Wait for request to be added to performance.getEntriesByName();<span class="line"><!---->    // Wait for request to be added to performance.getEntriesByName();<!----></span><br>    await new Promise(r => setTimeout(r, 200));<span class="line"><!---->    await new Promise(r =&gt; setTimeout(r, 200));<!----></span><br>    // Get last added timings<span class="line"><!---->    // Get last added timings<!----></span><br>    let res = performance.getEntriesByName(href).pop();<span class="line"><!---->    let res = performance.getEntriesByName(href).pop();<!----></span><br>    const diff = res.fetchStart - start;<span class="line"><!---->    const diff = res.fetchStart - start;<!----></span><br>    console.log('diff', diff);<span class="line"><!---->    console.log('diff', diff);<!----></span><br>    if(diff >= 1) return true<span class="line"><!---->    if(diff &gt;= 1) return true<!----></span><br>    return false;<span class="line"><!---->    return false;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>await isRedirected('<span class="line"><!---->await isRedirected('<!----></span>https://google.com');<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://google.com');"><!---->https://google.com');<!----></a> // diff: 169.5<span class="line"><!----> // diff: 169.5<!----></span><br>-><span class="line"><!---->-&gt;<!----></span><br>true<span class="line"><!---->true<!----></span><br><br>await isRedirected('<span class="line"><!---->await isRedirected('<!----></span>https://www.google.com');<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.google.com');"><!---->https://www.google.com');<!----></a> // diff: 0.20<span class="line"><!----> // diff: 0.20<!----></span><br>-><span class="line"><!---->-&gt;<!----></span><br>false<span class="line"><!---->false<!----></span><br><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br><br>Reporter credit: Tom Van Goethem<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Tom Van Goethem<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

            Issue 1295227: Security: PerformanceResourceTiming.fetchStart leaks cross-origin redirect status
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1295227: Security: PerformanceResourceTiming.fetchStart leaks cross-origin redirect status
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

        <div class="main-text">
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1295227: Security: PerformanceResourceTiming.fetchStart leaks cross-origin redirect status
          </h1>
          <small class="byline">
            Reported by

      <div class="main-text-outer">
        <div class="main-text">
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1295227: Security: PerformanceResourceTiming.fetchStart leaks cross-origin redirect status
          </h1>
          <small class="byline">
            Reported by
            <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Feb 8, 2022, 7:07 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
            
          </small>
        </div>
      </div>

        Description #1 by tomva...@gmail.com (Feb 8, 2022)
